abstracts.cdata!:
The overall outcome of the project is
            rated as highly unsatisfactory. The key lessons learned
            include: 1) Ownership is a sine qua non for project success.
            2) Lack of motivation was a severe problem in the Senegalese
            administration. A lesson for the Bank is to recognize that
            only when a proposed incentive system receives broad support
            by users and providers will it have a chance to be
            successfully implemented. 3) Institutional stability and
            continuity are essential to ensure responsibility for
            project outcome. 4) The Bank should adjust to realities. The
            institutional reality was staff turnover and lack of
            incentives. The political reality was lack of Government
            ownership and commitment to implement the program. By
            encouraging a disinterested government to extend the closing
            date three times, the Bank demonstrated indecisiveness and
            undermined its own credibility with the Borrower.
